citation.article-title: Novel chlamydiae in whiteflies and scale insects: endosymbionts ‘Candidatus Fritschea bemisiae’ strain Falk and ‘Candidatus Fritschea eriococci’ strain Elm
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: ‘Candidatus Fritschea eriococci’ (e.ri.o.coc′ci. N.L. gen. masc. n. eriococci of Eriococcus, the genus of scale insects in which it was first discovered).

The host range currently includes the scale insect Eriococcus spurius (Sternorrhyncha, Eriococcidae). ‘Candidatus Fritschea eriococci’ is currently known only by PCR and sequencing of DNA extracted from Eriococcus collected from an elm tree in Davis, CA, USA.
The rRNA operon does not include a tRNA (GenBank accession no. AY140911); unlike ‘Ca.
F. eriococci’ strain Elm does not have a 23S rRNA gene group I intron.
Strain Elm is the reference strain of the species ‘Ca.
